basics.name: Ailene Chan
basics.summary: Ph.D. candidate in Computational Neuroscience with over 7 years of experience conducting rigorous research in human perception and cognition. Skilled in designing and executing experimental protocols, performing quantitative and qualitative analyses, and applying multivariate statistical techniques to uncover meaningful insights. Proficient in Python and MATLAB for analyzing complex datasets and developing computational models. Experienced in scientific communication, technical writing, and fostering cross-disciplinary collaboration to drive impactful and innovative research outcomes.

work.name: Caltech
work.summary: Conducted extensive quantitative research into multisensory perception using psychophysical, neuroimaging, and computational techniques. Supervised undergraduate researchers and served as head teaching assistant for CNS 176 Cognition, helping shape the next generation of scientists.

work.name: The University of Hong Kong
work.summary: Studied the neural correlates of sensory eye dominance and audio-visual perception. Assisted in rehabilitative training for children with cortical blindness.

work.name: Boston Consulting Group
work.summary: Conducted literature review, market research, financial and data analyses on businesses in the healthcare sector. Assisted in expert interviews and making of presentation decks.

work.name: Stanford University
work.summary: Examined aging and neurodegeneration in mouse model, using immunohistochemistry, confocal microscopy, cell culture assays, and molecular assays.
